reviews.review:
Great action sequences, added some elements of the expanded universe.
Although I liked Episode 8 with everything and the controversial of his decisions, Rian Jonson pretended to disrespect him with what was stated in the previous movie and that causes the return of JJ Abrams to have to fix all those plot holes that his predecessor left causing that the film dedicates a third of the film with a lot of exposure and for the second act there is not much time left to develop its own story.

With everything and that closes some of the doubts although forced and that affects in his narrative, I would have liked that this film was Epsiodio 8 and had another film to cover the story more naturally. It's not perfect but I don't think it's the worst Star Wars movie, put yourself in Abrams shoes and believe me he did what he could to rescue her from being an absolute failure.
Makes up for the mess that was The Last Jedi and puts an old, devout fan at ease... Star Wars lives !!!

The film itself could have been rolled out into its own trilogy but with the cards the director had been dealt with, with The Last Jedi, this film is absolutely superb and wraps it up so well. There are a few ??? moments but otherwise I'm very satisfied with the ending. Thank you for saving the sequels !
The perfect ending - everything I could have asked for

I am a die-hard fan. However, fanservice does not require the resurrection of every conceivable character in a saga to tell a story. What we got was an entertaining but disjointed film with really corny dialogue, some truly bizarre tactics, some excellent special effects and a contrived ending. Sorry Disney. By tying this film and the rest of the trilogy to the Skywalker saga  which was wonderfully told in the Expanded Universe, you missed an opportunity to flesh out the stories of Rey and Kylo Ren. One thing that I noticed - Adam Driver really excelled in this movie. 
Was the movie great or even good? No.
Was it fun? Absolutely.
Was it a fitting end to a nine-part saga? Absolutely not.

It was not as bad as last jedi, the first half of the movie felt rushed and if this was like 2 movies it would have been a superb film, but due to time restraints some of the major plot points are blown past and only get fraction of screen time. It's action packed with good visuals and  storywise they could have done much MUCH MUCH worse, so its okay 3.5-4

(No spoilers here) - J. J. make a good job rewritting the wrong history in the ep. VIII but all the time that he use for repair the last film, he lost in make a really good end for the saga...then we had a good ending but we wait for see much more with some old friends... (6,5 / 10)
Tried to clean up a mess left by Rian Johnson but the damage was done. Good going, Disney.
Disgusting, extremely naive and full of fan-service, probably got half the script eaten by a mouse but decided to run it anyway

The best is that the Disney trilogy ended. 
Products like Mandalorian are what we really want!
